snippet: The pharmaceutical company, which sells a treatment for immune-related ailments at $28,000 a vial, bought a much cheaper alternative of the drug.
abstract: Questcor Pharmaceuticals acquires rights to Synacthen drug from Novartis, agreeing to pay at least $135 million; drug, sold in Europe but not in United States, is similar to Questcor's HP Acthar, used to treat various immune-related ailments.
lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical company, which sells a treatment for immune-related ailments at $28,000 a vial, bought a much cheaper alternative of the drug.

headline.main: Questcor Pays $135 Million to Acquire Rights to a Competitor’s Drug
headline.print_headline: Questcor Pays $135 Million to Acquire Rights to a Competitor’s Drug
